alert.note: Alert for Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 4:29AM EDT until August 16 at 6:45AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTH CENTRAL MONROE COUNTY... At 429 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms have produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain has fallen since Tuesday evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area early this morning as thunderstorms persist. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rochester, Greece, Irondequoit, Hilton, Brighton, Gates-North Gates, Charlotte, Braddock Bay and Rochester General Hospital. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
